titles.title: Entitled, the "California-Mexico Border Drug Trafficking Reduction Act".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Law, Immigration, and Refugees.

bill.summary: 2/2/1993--Introduced. Directs the Attorney General, for purposes of preventing the illegal entry of aliens into the United States, to: (1) acquire a permanent easement for the United States extending 50 feet outwards along the length of the U.S.-Mexico border in California for erecting and maintaining a security fence and access road; and (2) establish a 500-foot setback located along the length of such border for the purpose of restricting any development within such setback.
